title: Specialized Turbo Levo Alloy brings all the tech to lower priced eMTBs
content:
The all-new alloy Specialized Turbo Levo e-mountain bikes literally cut the cost of entry in half, with two models starting at just $5,500. And there are new carbon models that bring those versions down to $11,000, which sounds like a lot until you realize the S-Works model is $15k, and the Pro model jumped to

The post Specialized Turbo Levo Alloy brings all the tech to lower priced eMTBs appeared first on Bikerumor.
author: Tyler Benedict
